channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Scott Bessent insists he’s ‘not concerned at all’ about investors Selling America—despite the fact it’s unravelled tariffs before
item.description: “Denmark’s investment in U.S. Treasury bonds, like Denmark itself, is irrelevant," said Scott Bessent.

item.title: Man Gets Life in Prison for Killing Shinzo Abe, Former Leader of Japan
item.description: Tetsuya Yamagami, 45, had admitted to shooting Mr. Abe, Japan’s longest-serving prime minister; but his case divided Japan.

item.title: Taiwan’s $40 Billion Military Spending Plan Stalled by Political Impasse
item.description: Taiwan’s domestic gridlock is revealing a deep-seated fracture over how the island should defend itself and how much it can depend on the United State...

item.title: Majority of Latin Americans Endorsed Trump’s Intervention In Venezuela, Polls Show
item.description: Several polls show that a majority of Latin Americans who were questioned endorsed the intervention, suggesting a shift, at least for now, from ideolo...

item.title: Hotels allege predatory pricing, forced exclusivity in Trip.com antitrust probe
item.description: For many hotels, visibility—and sometimes survival—comes at the expense of profits.

item.title: CEOs at Davos are buying into the agentic AI hype
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: The U.S. debt now equals $229,000 per household—and a hefty tax hike looms as the most probable outcome
item.description: Spiraling interest payments—which grew from $352 billion in 2021 to $970 billion in 2025—put the debt train on an accelerated track.

item.title: Exclusive: Alphabet’s CapitalG names Jill Chase and Alex Nichols as general partners
item.description: For the first time since CapitalG was started in 2013, the firm is promoting two general partners, Jill Chase and Alex Nichols, Fortune has exclusivel...

item.title: Trump 2.0
item.description: We look at the first year of the president’s second term.

item.title: Rising Global Temperatures May Affect Choices for Winter Olympic Venues
item.description: Future games will need to be held at higher altitudes, and spread over multiple venues in order to adapt to a changing climate, new research suggests.

item.description: Taiwan’s domestic gridlock is revealing a deep-seated fracture over how the island should defend itself and how much it can depend on the United State...

item.title: Supreme Court to Weigh Trump’s Bid to Fire Lisa Cook
item.description: The Supreme Court is hearing oral arguments on Wednesday in the case of Lisa Cook, the Federal Reserve governor whom President Trump is trying to fire...

item.title: Greenland Tensions Rattle Global Markets
item.description: A slump in U.S. stocks spilled into markets in Asia and Europe on Wednesday, ending a period of relative calm.
